name: Suno

score_rationale.persistence: Launched late 2023, ~2 years operational. Rapid iteration (v4.5 in May 2025). Well-funded with hundreds of millions raised. Strong trajectory.
score_rationale.autonomy: Generates complete songs from text prompts. Tool that enables creation rather than autonomous creator. Users direct the generation. 'Assisted' tier.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: First AI music on Billboard charts (Breaking Rust #1 Country Digital, #9 Emerging Artists). Professional songwriters using daily. $3M record deal signed (Xania Monet). Reshaping music industry.
score_rationale.economic_reality: Hundreds of millions in funding. First AI-creator record deal. $500M lawsuit settlement with Warner Music Group (2025). Major commercial entity with real industry impact.
score_rationale.governance: Corporate governance. Warner Music Group now has ownership stakes per settlement. No community governance.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: v4.5: 1,200+ genres, 8-minute tracks, 44.1kHz studio quality. Stem editing, vocal/instrumental separation. Most advanced consumer-facing AI music generation.

curator_notes: Suno represents the commercialization breakthrough for AI music generation. Unlike research systems like Jukebox, Suno has achieved mainstream adoptionâ€”Recording Academy CEO Harvey Mason Jr. says 'every' songwriter he knows has used it. 2025 milestones: Breaking Rust became first AI act to top a Billboard chart; Hallwood Media signed AI artist Xania Monet for $3M; Suno settled with Warner Music Group for $500M. The platform's v4.5 supports 1,200+ genres and 8-minute tracks at studio quality. While Suno is a tool (users prompt) rather than autonomous agent, its cultural impact on music creation is undeniable.

evidence.claim: First AI music on Billboard charts (Breaking Rust #1 Country Digital)
$500M Warner Music settlement, $3M record deal signed
